topic.title: Reusable Safety Statements
topic.shortdesc: Common safety statements used in labs.

p.b: WHEN THERE ARE NO SPECIFIC SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS

body.p: Follow regular lab safety procedures.
Wear safety goggles at all times.
Tie back long hair, roll up long sleeves, and remove dangling jewelry.
Use gloves if available.
Notify your instructor of spills and clean up as directed.
If chemicals get on your skin, immediately rinse thoroughly with running water and notify your instructor.
Use caution with hot water.
Use caution when using the hot plate.
Use beaker tongs when handling hot water.
Use caution around open flames.
No open flames are permitted during this investigation.
Do not point the test tube opening towards yourself or anyone else while heating the test tube.
If using matches, light the match before turning on the gas.
If using a flint striker, make sure you know how to produce a spark before turning on the gas.
Allow the light bulb to cool before moving.
Never eat or drink in the lab even when working with food.
Wash your hands thoroughly when finished with the investigation.
Avoid contact with eyes or skin when handling materials.

p.note: Hot water is listed in HEAT- AND FIRE-RELATED section above

body.p: Do not let the sensor get wet.
Use caution with acids and bases.
When diluting acid, add acid to water, not the other way around.
Dispose of chemicals in the proper waste container as directed by your instructor.
Work in a well-ventilated area.
Use the fume hood as directed by your instructor.
Keep water away from electrical outlets and all electronic equipment.

p.b: SHARP OR FRAGILE EQUIPMENT AND GLASSWARE

body.p: Use caution when handling a knife or scalpel and always cut in a direction away from your body.
Inspect glassware and notify your instructor if it is chipped or cracked.
Do not use cracked or chipped microscope slides.
Handle and treat living organisms with care.
Return preserved specimens to their appropriate container.
Dispose of specimens as directed by your instructor.
